childMarkdownRemark.html:
Ingredients:

  • 4 cups young coconut meat (buko), shredded
  • 1 cup pandan-flavored gelatin, cubed
  • 1 can (14 oz) condensed milk
  • 1 can (12 oz) evaporated milk
  • 1 cup coconut water (buko juice)
  • 1 cup coconut cream (kakang gata)
  • Crushed ice

Instructions:

  1. In a large bowl, combine the shredded coconut meat, pandan-flavored gelatin cubes, condensed milk, evaporated milk, and coconut water. Mix well to incorporate all the ingredients.

  2. Add crushed ice to a serving pitcher or individual glasses.

  3. Pour the coconut mixture over the ice, filling the pitcher or glasses.

  4. Drizzle the coconut cream on top of the mixture.

  5. Stir gently to combine the flavors and ensure even distribution of the coconut cream.

  6. Serve Buko Pandan chilled and enjoy the refreshing flavors of coconut and pandan.

Note: You can adjust the sweetness of the Buko Pandan by adding more or less condensed milk according to your preference. You can also add additional pandan flavoring or essence for a stronger pandan taste. Feel free to garnish with additional shredded coconut or pandan leaves for an extra touch.

Enjoy your delicious Buko Pandan, a popular Filipino beverage!
